DOCNAME: CASE OF NECATI EROL v. TURKEY
JUDGES: András Sajó;David Thór Björgvinsson;Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG of Highways seized a plot of land belonging to the applicant without any formal expropriation , for the construction of a highway . The applicant brought an action before ORG to obtain compensation for the de facto expropriation of his property . He requested MONEY ( TRY ) as compensation from the court and reserved his right to increase this claim in due course .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant TRY CARDINAL as compensation for the de facto expropriation of his land , as requested , plus interest . The applicant initiated execution proceedings before ORG to obtain that amount ( file no . CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . The applicant subsequently brought an additional action ( “ ek dava ” ) before ORG to obtain further compensation for his land in the light of the expert report obtained during the previous proceedings , which had valued the land at a rate higher than that initially requested by him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant TRY CARDINAL , plus interest . The applicant initiated another set of execution proceedings before ORG to obtain the amount awarded ( file no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the administration paid TRY CARDINAL and CARDINAL respectively to the files before ORG . According to the information provided by the applicant , there has been no outstanding debt in the execution files .
